item.title: Latest Game Announcements – March 26, 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/latest-game-announcements-march-26-2025/

Every week new games are announced or major updates come for previously announced games. Sometimes, it happens at such a pace that it’s impossible for the average player to keep up with the latest game announcements.

At Insider Gaming, we want to help with that. In addition to our recently launched calendar, we are providing a weekly round up of all of the latest game announcements that you need to know about.

No matter how big or small, we want to make sure you know about the latest game reveals, updates, and release date announcements. Starting today, every Wednesday will see a list of the games you may want to keep an eye on. From puzzle games to large-scale multiplayer titles, the goal is to make sure there is a game for everyone.

If you are a developer, publisher, or agency that wants to make sure your games are included in the next round up, please email senior editor Mike Straw at [email protected].

Latest Video Game Announcements – March 26, 2025

Hero’s Hand

Hero’s Hand is a poker-themed roguelike RPG. The game has you try to create the best poker hand possible in order to defeat various enemies and save the land of Cardunia.

Hero’s Hand launches in 2026 for PS5, Xbox Series, Nintendo Switch, and PC via Steam. Villain Games is handling both the development and publishing.

How 2 Escape: Lost Submarine

How 2 Escape: Lost Submarine has you team with a friend to reach a lost submarine and prevent a war from breaking out. The game has you play on two separate devices—the main game on the system of choice and a companion app for player 2—to solve the puzzles needed to prevent catastrophe.

How 2 Escape: Lost Submarine will release later in 2025 for PS5, PS4, Xbox One (Xbox Series Compatible), PC via Steam, and Nintendo Switch. The game is being developer by Breakfirst Games and is co-published by Breakfirst and Maximum Entertainment.

Let Them Come: Onslaught

Let Them Come: Onslaught from Tuatara Games and Digital Bandidos sees you stranded on an alien world fighting to escape. The game is set to launch in 2025 for PS5, PS5, Xbox Series, Nintendo Switch and PC.

ScholoMatch

From Dire Kitten Games, ScholoMatch is a match-3 visual novel that tells the story of a group of students at Horizon Academy. The game features 11 main characters to follow as the story unfolds. It’s currently scheduled for a full release in Fall 2025 on PC via Steam.

Willow Guard

Willow Guard is a single-player story-driven RPG that mixes choice-based interactions with dungeon-crawling gameplay. The game launches on April 10, 2025 for PC via Steam. Willow Guard is developed and published by MiTale.

Wildgate

Wildgate comes from Moonshot Games and Dreamhaven. The game features online matchups featuring five teams with four players as they search through space to retrieve and leave through the Wildgate with the Artifact. The game features PvPvE action, including player- and ship-based combat.

The game is set to release in 2025 for Xbox Series, PS5, and PC.

Moroi

Developer Violet Saint and publisher Good Shepherd Entertainment have revealed the release date for its upcoming hack-and-slash adventure game Moroi. The game is scheduled to release on April 30 on PC via Steam. Those who want to try the game out before buying it can download a demo.

F1 25

From EA Sports and developer Codemasters, F1 25 is the latest installment in the long-running Formula 1 franchise. This year’s game releases on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC on May 27 for those who buy the game’s “Iconic Edition”.

item.title: Star Wars is Returning to Fortnite Chapter 6 Season 3, It’s Claimed
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/star-wars-is-returning-to-fortnite-chapter-6-season-3-its-claimed/

A new claim states that a Star Wars collaboration is planned for Fortnite Chapter 6 Season 3. 

Fortnite’s Chapter 6 Season 2 ends on May 2, 2025, and post that date, according to a post by FNBRintel on X (via Hypex), Season 3 will kick off with a Star Wars collaboration. The Star Wars collaboration will arrive as a mini-season that lasts approximately 30-35 days. The update will include a new POI based on the series, new mythics, skins, and other content. 

Loolo_Wrld, who recently leaked a Fortnite x Daima collaboration, also corroborated the Star Wars Season 3 rumour while adding more details. Players should expect new Star Wars Bosses, NPCs, POIs, and items in Fortnite accounting to their posts. Moreover, the battle pass will seemingly feature 4-5 themed skins as well. 

Fortnite and Star Wars have been collaborating since 2019, with new content arriving each year. Fortnite is known to have a new Star Wars collaboration or content ready for players each year on May 4, also known as Star Wars Day. Some of the most popular characters from the franchise, like the Mandalorian, Darth Vader, Han Solo, and a bunch more, have already been introduced to the game.

Last year, we saw the likes of Chewbacca, Dagobah Luke, Lando Calrissian, and AWR Trooper join the game. The collaboration was across several of Fortnite’s game modes, including Battle Royale, LEGO Fortnite, Fortnite Festival, and Rocket Racing. It will be interesting to see what Star Wars property Fortnite brings over this year, whether a new game, TV show, or movie. 

In other news, a Fortnite leaker has confirmed that Mortal Kombat content is finally coming to Fortnite. Sabrina Carpenter could also be the next Fortnite Festival Icon. What are your thoughts on Star Wars returning to Fortnite for Chapter 6, Season 3? Let us know in the comments or on our community forum!

item.title: New Lies of P: Overture Details Revealed
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/new-lies-of-p-overture-details-revealed/

Lies of P: Overture is scheduled to release sometime later this summer, and new details on what players can expect have come out.

Thanks to a recent interview with Eurogamer, Lies of P: Overture director Choi Ji-won gave insight into where the upcoming prequel stands in terms of experience and in relation to the original Lies of P.

According to Choi, the story of Lies of P: Overture will be “accessible seamlessly from around chapter nine of the base game.” That means the new story is integrated into the original as opposed to being a completely standalone tale.

“We never really saw the development of Overture as a separate entity,” said Choi to Eurogamer. “With the base game and the expansion together, we believe that the whole entire thing delivers the game of Lies of P as how it was supposed to be experienced. We just couldn’t do that earlier on.”

As far as length is concerned, Lies of P: Overture will take “experience players” roughly 15-20 hours to complete. It features new locations, enemies, bosses, weapons, and characters. Two of those new weapons are a bow and claws, though not much else was given away by Choi.

Lastly, when it comes to what the DLC will actually be, Choi told IGN in a separate interview that players should replay the base game. He says that there are various clues throughout that give hints as to what you’ll get with Overture. He also made it clear that the final cutscene of the game is unrelated to what will be in Overture. That scene—don’t worry, no spoilers here—is a tease for future adventures from the developer.

item.title: F1 25 Officially Revealed; Releases May 27
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/f1-25-officially-revealed-releases-may-27/

EA Sports and Codemasters have officially revealed F1 25, the latest installment in the long-running Formula 1 racing franchise. The game will be available for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC starting May 27 for those who buy the Iconic Edition of the game.

Those who buy the base game get it starting May 30.

As with any new release of an annual franchise, the biggest questions surround the improvements and new features coming to the game. With F1 25, Codemasters is bringing back a new installment of the Braking Point story mode with Braking Point 3.

“Hot off the heels of the 2023 season and under new ownership, the familiar faces of Callie Mayer, Aiden Jackson, and of course, Devon Butler, make their return,” the mode’s description reads. “However, with a dramatic event threatening to derail their title aspirations, will you have what it takes to steer the team to championship glory?”

In addition to the story mode, F1 2025 features a crossover with the upcoming F1 The Movie, bringing in the APXGP race team for use in both My Team and Driver Career as well as various post-launch chapters “inspired by the film”.

Elsewhere, My Team is getting its “biggest overhaul since it was introduced”. The mode will see you have new challenges and responsibilities as the owner of an F1 team. More specific details on what that entails will be revealed closer to the game’s launch.

Lastly, the game’s EGO engine has been updated along with improved “circuit authenticity made possible through LIDAR technology”.

Are you excited about F1 25 now that it’s been officially revealed? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.
